question: 竹の子
sourceMnemonic: What is a <kanji>child</kanji> of <kanji>bamboo</kanji>? That would be a baby bamboo. Because "baby bamboo" doesn't really make sense, we'll instead call this word <vocabulary>bamboo shoots</vocabulary>. P.S. Fresh bamboo shoots cooked on a fire are delicious, make sure you try them sometime.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If you know the readings of the kanji for <ja>竹</ja> and the vocabulary for <ja>子</ja> you should be able to read this word as well.
